titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Peter Miller, Judgment
CWG4297

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Mason Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Copy agreement of facts & Judgment
Peter Miller Defendant

It is agreed that the negro boy Ed belonged to Saml. W. Wood that he was hired by Saml. W. Wood his master to a free negro barber Nathaniel Oldham, and while thus hired to Oldham the boy and Oldham his master for the time, drank at Peter Millers bar and purchased from him at the County of Mason upon one occasion, the whiskey & beer drank having been furnished Ned & paid for by him in the presence of and at the instance of Oldham the free negro to whom he was hired.
At a Court held for the Mason Circuit on the 7th day of October 1863
"By consent of the parties the law and facts herein are submitted to the Court.

And the Court having fully heard the parties and being sufficiently advised adjudges that the plaintiff recover of said defendant Peter Miller the sum of Fifty dollars and also her costs herein expended.

A copy Attest
Jno M. Duke Jr C. M. C. C.

Comlth of Ky
vs } copy agreement of Facts & Judgment
Peter Miller.
